0.title: Ukraine to create 'IT army' to hit Russian websites
0.article_body: Ukraine is planning to launch an 'IT army' to strike Russia on the cyber front, said the country's Vice Prime Minister Mykhailo Fedorov. "We are creating an IT army. We need digital talents," tweeted Fedorov. He also shared a list of prominent Russian websites, saying, "There will be tasks for everyone. We continue to fight on the cyber front."

1.title: Google blocks Russia's RT, other channels from making ad money
1.article_body: Alphabet's Google on Saturday blocked Russia's state-owned media outlet RT and other channels from receiving money for ads on their websites, apps and YouTube videos after Russia invaded Ukraine on Thursday. Russian media will not be able to buy ads through Google Tools or place ads on Google services. We'll take further steps if necessary, Google spokesman Michael Aciman said.

2.title: Horrific experience: Shabana Azmi on 21-yr-old niece left on bridge at night by Ola driver
2.article_body: Actress Shabana Azmi shared her 21-year-old niece's "horrific experience" where her Ola cab allegedly left her mid-ride on Mumbai's Dadar bridge in the night. "Driver realised...he'd reach home late due to traffic...so he made me get off on Dadar bridge," her niece said. "I had to walk down the bridge...It took me 2 hours to reach my destination," she added.

3.title: Stakhovsky to take up arms to fight Russia, says 'I've experience with a gun'
3.article_body: Former Ukrainian tennis player Sergiy Stakhovsky has enlisted himself in his country's reserve army amid war with Russia. "I would fight, it’s the only reason I’m trying to get back. I don’t have military experience, but I do have experience with a gun privately," he said. Earlier, Klitschko brothers took up arms to defend Ukraine against Russia.

4.title: Japanese billionaire donates $8.7 mn to Ukraine, says 'Met Ukraine Prez in 2019'
4.article_body: Japanese billionaire Hiroshi 'Mickey' Mikitani, the Chairman and CEO of electronic commerce company Rakuten, has donated $8.7 million to Ukraine. He called Russia's attack "a challenge to democracy". In a letter to Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy, Hiroshi said, "I vividly remember the early summer of 2019 as if it were yesterday when I visited Kiev and met with you."

5.title: Australian cricket team lands in Pakistan for 1st tour in 24 years, pics surface
5.article_body: Members of the 18-member squad picked for Australian men's cricket team's first trip to Pakistan in 24 years landed in Islamabad during the early hours of Sunday morning. Australia last played in Pakistan in 1998, winning the three-match Test series 1-0 and winning the ODI series 3-0. The upcoming Test series will be Pat Cummins' first overseas series as captain.

6.title: Don't want to be captain just for personal satisfaction, it is just a post: Bumrah
6.article_body: India pacer Jasprit Bumrah said he doesn't want to be captain just for personal satisfaction. "It's just a post...it's just a name, you've to do your job and you have to help people in the best way you can," he added. Bumrah further said, "Whatever role is asked of me I'd do it with the best ability that I can."

7.title: 26.11-carat diamond found by man in MP mine sold for ₹1.62 crore
7.article_body: The 26.11-carat diamond found by a brick kiln operator in Madhya Pradesh's Panna district was sold for ₹1.62 crore during an auction, an official said on Sunday. The brick kiln operator had found the diamond in a shallow mine. In the auction, 87 other rough diamonds fetched a total of ₹1.89 crore.

8.title: Russia's actions bear signs of genocide, kids will be killed subtly: Ukrainian Prez
8.article_body: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Sunday urged the world to scrap Russia’s voting power at the UN Security Council. He said, "They are going to bomb our Ukrainian cities, even more, they are going to kill our children even more subtly...Russia's criminal actions against Ukraine bear signs of genocide." Russian forces have entered into Ukraine's second-largest city, Kharkiv.

9.title: Ukraine govt shares pic of residential building shelled by Russia near Kyiv
9.article_body: Ukraine's Centre for Strategic Communications and Information Security took to Twitter to share a picture of a residential building shelled by Russian army. "Russia is committing war crimes. Today Russian army shelled a residential building in Bucha...15 km from Kyiv," it wrote. It also said that Russian tanks shot down a bus with civilians in Okhtyrka district of Sumy region.

10.title: Video shows cyclist being hit by explosive in Ukraine amid Russian invasion
10.article_body: CCTV footage has surfaced on social media that showed a cyclist being hit by an explosive in Ukraine amid the Russian invasion. The video showed the person being thrown from his bike after an orange flash was seen, seemingly from an explosive that hit him. Another video of the incident also showed him crawling from his bike before lying still.

11.title: Ukraine's former beauty queen joins fight against Russian troops
11.article_body: Former Miss Grand Ukraine Anastasiia Lenna has joined the fight against the Russian forces. Lenna, who was Ukraine’s 2015 representative in the Miss Grand International beauty contest, shared photos of her holding a gun. She also shared an Instagram Story featuring Ukrainian soldiers and wrote, "Everyone who crosses the Ukrainian border with the intent to invade will be killed!"

12.title: Ajith's 'Valimai' earns ₹100 crore worldwide in 3 days, Huma shares post
12.article_body: Ajith Kumar-starrer 'Valimai' has crossed the ₹100 crore mark at the worldwide box office within three days of its release. Huma Qureshi, who plays a character named Sophia in the action-thriller film, shared a tweet celebrating the film's milestone, writing, "Woo hoo! Thank you for all the love." 'Valimai' is directed by H Vinoth and produced by Boney Kapoor.

13.title: Means a lot to start new life from grandparents' house: Sheetal on wedding
13.article_body: Actress Sheetal Thakur took to Instagram to share video of her Himachal wedding with actor Vikrant Massey and said that it means a lot to her to start her "new life" from her grandparents' house. "It's a village or whatever people call it. But this is me," she said in the video. Sheetal and Vikrant got married on February 18.

14.title: Radhe Shyam makers install free astrology booths in cinema halls across India
14.article_body: The makers of Prabhas-starrer 'Radhe Shyam' have installed astrology booths in a lot of cinema halls across India. Every booth is equipped with an astrologer who'll read the palms of people free of cost. Reportedly, the booths have already been attracting massive crowds across the theatres. In 'Radhe Shyam', Prabhas, too, will be seen essaying the role of a palmist.

15.title: Amrita Rao shares edited 'Vivah' pic to wish Shahid Kapoor on birthday
15.article_body: Actress Amrita Rao took to Instagram to share a photoshopped picture from the movie 'Vivah' to wish her co-star and actor Shahid Kapoor on his birthday. "Happy birthday dear Shahid," she wrote. She reportedly also added the song 'Tum Jiyo Hazaron Saal' to her post. Shahid responded by saying, "Thanks so much, Amrita."

16.title: Shruti Haasan tests COVID +ve, says 'I'm on the mend, will be back soon'
16.article_body: Actress Shruti Haasan took to Instagram on Sunday to share that she has tested positive for COVID-19.  "Hi everyone! A quick not so fun update. Despite all safety measures I have tested positive for Covid. I'm on the mend and can't wait to be back very soon," she wrote. Several people wished her a speedy recovery.

17.title: 15 students from Telangana stranded in Ukraine return to Hyderabad
17.article_body: As many as 15 students from Telangana, who were stranded in Ukraine after Russia invaded the country, arrived in Hyderabad on Sunday morning. They were received by Shamshabad MLA Prakash Goud and a local corporator. "As per our information...second batch of students will be repatriated in Delhi. From there, Telangana-Andhra students will come to Hyderabad," DCP of Shamshabad said.

18.title: Words not enough to praise PM Modi’s role amid Ukraine crisis: Rajnath Singh
18.article_body: Campaigning in UP's Bairia, Union Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Sunday hailed Prime Minister Narendra Modi's role amid the Ukraine crisis. "Words are not enough to praise PM Modi for his role," said Singh. He also said, "Earlier, when India used to speak on global stages, the world didn't take it seriously. Now when India speaks, the world pays attention."

19.title: Ishan Kishan discharged from hospital, unlikely to play 3rd T20I
19.article_body: India batter Ishan Kishan, who was hospitalised after he was hit on the helmet by a bouncer during the second T20I against Sri Lanka in Dharamshala, has been discharged. "Kishan is under close observation of BCCI's medical team," a source told ANI. The source added that Kishan is unlikely to play the third T20I against Sri Lanka in Dharamshala.

20.title: Shreyas is aware that he might not start at T20 WC 2022: Karthik
20.article_body: Dinesh Karthik said India batter Shreyas Iyer has guaranteed a strong place in 2022 T20 World Cup squad following his performance in ongoing T20I series against Sri Lanka. "He's aware at...back of his mind...he might not start at...World Cup. But...first step is to put a seat on that flight," he added. Shreyas was adjudged 'Player of Match' in second T20I.

21.title: Finally contributing to team's success means a lot to me: Sanju Samson
21.article_body: India batter Sanju Samson, who batted for the first time in a T20I match since July last year, has said he's happy with his 39-run innings in the second T20I against Sri Lanka. "The rhythm wasn't there for the starting 10-12 balls...So I took a bit of extra time...finally contributing positively to the team's success means a lot," he added.

22.title: Mattress godown gutted in fire in Pune's Pisoli, no one injured
22.article_body: A mattress godown was gutted in a fire in Pune's Pisoli area on Saturday night. No injury was reported as all employees had left the godown in the evening. "We had deployed 10 fire tenders and it took about 2.5 hours to douse the fire," an official said, adding that the building was highly inflammable.

23.title: Chhattisgarh to generate electricity from cattle dung, agricultural waste
23.article_body: The Bhabha Atomic Research Centre (BARC) is going to help the Chhattisgarh government generate electricity from cattle dung and agricultural waste. Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel has asked state Principal Secretary Amitabh Jain to submit an action plan in two weeks "for scientific and systematic use of cow urine in the agriculture sector".

24.title: Ghaziabad civic body plans to revive 28 ponds before monsoon
24.article_body: Ghaziabad Municipal Corporation has announced that it plans to revive 28 ponds in its jurisdiction before the arrival of the monsoon this year. The civic body said that it has revived 10 water bodies so far. "The rejuvenation work may not directly help us in getting...drinking water...but it will...help us in...recharging of groundwater resources," the Ghaziabad Municipal Commissioner said.

25.title: Israeli billionaire to give oil, mining assets back to Congo
25.article_body: A company controlled by Israeli billionaire Dan Gertler will give control of valuable mining and oil assets back to Congo, the Congolese government has confirmed. The assets are reportedly estimated to be worth over $2 billion. Notably, the US had imposed sanctions on Gertler and several of his businesses in 2017 and 2018 for alleged corruption in Congo.

26.title: 14 shot at hookah bar in Las Vegas; 1 killed
26.article_body: As many as 14 people were shot at a hookah bar in US' Las Vegas. One of them died while two others are said to be critical. The shootout reportedly began following an altercation between two people at a party. "We're not sure exactly what kind of weapon was used, or if there were two shooters," said police.

27.title: 17,914 street children in India, highest in Maharashtra: NCPCR to SC
27.article_body: There are 17,914 street children or "children in street situations" across India, the National Commission for Protection of Child Rights (NCPCR) told the Supreme Court. The Commission added that Maharashtra has the highest number of children living on the streets at 4,952. Out of 17,914 children, 834 kids live on the streets alone.

28.title: 23-year-old man robbed of mobile phone at knifepoint by 4 men in Pune
28.article_body: A 23-year-old man was allegedly robbed of his mobile phone worth ₹40,000 at knifepoint by four unidentified men in Pune at around 1:30 am on Sunday. The incident reportedly took place when the man was standing and talking on his phone near his parked motorcycle in the Koregaon Park area. A case has been registered against the accused.

29.title: UP is crime, terrorism free; everyone feels safe: Minister Mohsin Raza
29.article_body: Uttar Pradesh minister Mohsin Raza, after casting his vote in Lucknow, said that the state is crime and terrorism free and that "everyone feels safe". "People are getting jobs. We've made UP economy number two and will also make it number one and people are voting for that. We are forming the government," he added.

30.title: 30-yr-old woman kills self in Punjab, blames husband in suicide note
30.article_body: A 30-year-old woman died by suicide in Punjab. She reportedly blamed her husband in her suicide note. The woman alleged that her husband beat her up daily and was responsible for her death. The woman's father said that she had married her husband in 2016 and the couple had a two-year-old daughter. The police have arrested the husband in case.

31.title: Bajrang Dal activist's killing must be treated as act of terror: Tejasvi Surya
31.article_body: BJP MP from Bengaluru South Tejasvi Surya said the Karnataka government must treat the Bajrang Dal activist Harsha's killing in Shivamogga like "an act of terror." A special unit should be set up to deal with such cases as the police alone are inadequate, he added. "Harsha's case must be prosecuted u/s UAPA and investigation must be comprehensive," Surya stated.

32.title: Gang involved in tyre theft busted in Hyd, tyres worth ₹29.64 lakh seized
32.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police arrested three members of a gang involved in the theft of tyres and recovered materials worth ₹44.72 lakh from their possession. Police seized 152 MRF tyres worth ₹29.64 lakh and other things. The gang members did a recce at truck factories and warehouses, and got into loaded vehicles posing as passengers seeking a lift, police said.

33.title: Gujarat's PSI suspended for allowing constables to travel in private car
33.article_body: Gujarat's Bharatnagar police station incharge MS Yadav was suspended from service on Tuesday for allowing the four constables killed in an accident on February 15 to travel in a private car. "We had permitted them to travel by train...the PSI allowed the constables to go to Delhi driving a car belonging to a private person," IGP Ashok Kumar Yadav said.

34.title: EC bans BJP’s UP candidate over 'go to Pakistan' remark
34.article_body: The Election Commission has banned BJP candidate from UP's Tiloi constituency, Mayankeshwar Sharan Singh, from making public statements for 24 hours over inflammatory speech. "If you have to live in India, (you will have) to chant 'Radhey-Radhey'. Otherwise, like all those who went to Pakistan during Partition, you can go too, you are not needed here," Singh had said.

35.title: Tesla Fremont plant toilets had racist symbols writings: Fired worker
35.article_body: A former Tesla employee, Marc Cage, has sued the firm alleging he was fired for reporting widespread safety violations and race discrimination at Tesla's factories. "Virtually every restroom in Tesla's Fremont facility contained writings or carvings of racist symbols and slurs," Cage said. He added Tesla employees denigrated and harassed him, with the knowledge of the management.

36.title: One day he started singing loudly in the hospital: Bappi Lahiri's son
36.article_body: When asked if Bappi Lahiri listened to music in the hospital, the late singer's son Bappa Lahiri said yes, adding, that one day he started singing loudly in the hospital. Bappa said his father was in the hospital for a large part of last month. "On February 14, he...kept saying 'ghar chalo ghar chalo' (Let's go home)," Bappa added.

37.title: Archer is one bowler I would like to face: 19-year-old Yash Dhull
37.article_body: India's 2022 Under-19 World Cup-winning captain Yash Dhull, who's currently playing in the ongoing Ranji Trophy, has said England pacer Jofra Archer is one bowler he would like to face in the future. "I would [also] love to make a partnership with David Warner [during IPL]," he added. Dhull scored twin centuries on his first-class debut for Delhi.

38.title: Muslims not happy with Samajwadi Party, won't vote for them: Mayawati
38.article_body: Bahujan Samaj Party chief Mayawati said that Muslims are not happy with the Samajwadi Party and will not vote for them. "People of UP have rejected SP even before voting as voting for SP means Gunda raj and Mafia raj. Riots happened in SP government. The face of SP leaders tell that they are not coming in power," she added.

39.title: Worked with dialect coach, had to get Bombaiya accent: Alia on 'Gangubai..'
39.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt said she started preparing for 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' with "basic technical preparations". "From voice modulation to getting...Gujarati characteristics...I had a dialect coach...Since she spent a lot of time in Mumbai...I had to get some Bombaiya accent," she said, adding, "I feel the actual preparations happen when you start enacting scenes...with try and error."

40.title: Karnataka reports 767 new COVID-19 cases; 552 in Bengaluru alone
40.article_body: Karnataka reported 767 new coronavirus cases on Tuesday, as per data provided by the state health department. Of the new cases, 552 were reported from the state capital, Bengaluru, alone. The state also reported 29 more coronavirus-related deaths, out of which 14 were reported from Bengaluru. The total number of active coronavirus cases in the city has risen to 5,255.

41.title: World's richest man Elon Musk dating 27-yr-old actress Natasha Bassett: Reports
41.article_body: Elon Musk, the 50-year-old Tesla CEO who's the world's richest man, is dating 27-year-old Australian actress Natasha Bassett, reports said. A few days ago, she was photographed leaving Musk's private jet in Los Angeles. Musk and Bassett were friends first and began dating after Musk's split with Canadian singer Grimes, with whom he had his son 'X Æ A-Xii'.

42.title: Rainfall warning issued for 19 states/UTs over next five days, list released
42.article_body: IMD has said that widespread rainfall is very likely over J&K, Himachal Pradesh and Uttarakhand during next two days and scattered rainfall for subsequent three days. Other states/UTs which may see rainfall over next five days are Punjab, Haryana, Chandigarh, Uttar Pradesh, Bihar, Jharkhand, Odisha, West Bengal, Sikkim, Arunachal Pradesh, Meghalaya, Nagaland, Assam, Manipur, Mizoram and Tripura.

43.title: Putin is a 'genius', he is 'very savvy': Trump on Putin's Ukraine move
43.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump has called Russian President Vladimir Putin a "genius" for his decision to recognise two breakaway Ukrainian regions as independent. "Here's a guy who's very savvy...I know him very well," Trump added. Accusing US President Joe Biden of being "weak", Trump said, "This never would have happened had I been in office."

44.title: Russia's richest people lose $32 billion this year amid Ukraine crisis
44.article_body: The net worth of Russia's 23 billionaires has fallen by $32 billion to $343 billion so far this year amid the Ukraine crisis, as per Bloomberg. Gennady Timchenko, who's a close ally of Russian President Vladimir Putin, has seen his wealth disappear by almost a third this year. Meanwhile, Novatek shareholder Leonid Mikhelson's fortune has fallen by $6.2 billion.

45.title: Voting underway on 59 seats across 9 districts in 4th phase of UP Assembly polls
45.article_body: Voting for 59 Assembly constituencies spread across nine districts of Uttar Pradesh began at 7 am on Wednesday in the fourth phase of the polls and will continue till 6 pm. The fourth phase of polling will decide the fate of 624 candidates of Pilibhit, Lakhimpur Kheri, Sitapur, Hardoi, Unnao, Lucknow, Raebareli, Banda and Fatehpur.

46.title: HC issues notice to Delhi govt over PIL against CCTVs inside classrooms
46.article_body: Delhi High Court on Tuesday issued a notice to the Delhi government asking it to reply to a PIL challenging the decision to install CCTV cameras inside classrooms of Delhi schools and the consequent live-streaming of such video footage to third persons. The installation of CCTVs in classrooms without consent violates the right to privacy, the PIL states.

47.title: US imposes sanctions on Russian banks, elites; Biden says 'Invasion of Ukraine has begun'
47.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Tuesday said that the country was imposing a first tranche of sanctions against Russia, adding, "This is the beginning of a Russian invasion of Ukraine." Biden said the sanctions applied to VEB bank and Russia's military bank - Promsvyazbank, which does defence deals. Sanctions were also imposed against Russian elites and their family members.

48.title: Employee runs away with ₹14 lakh from gas agency in Pune, booked
48.article_body: An employee of a gas agency has been booked by Pune Police for allegedly running away with  ₹14,13,160 from agency. The employee was reportedly asked to deposit the money in the bank. A 43-year-old man, who owns the gas agency, filed a complaint in the case. A case under Sections 406 and 381 of Indian Penal Code has been registered.

49.title: 12-yr-old boy falls from terrace of 7-storey building in Mumbai, dies
49.article_body: A 12-year-old boy died after falling from the terrace of a seven-storey building in Mumbai's Vashi on Monday. He was playing on a trampoline kept on the building terrace when he lost control and fell on the ground floor, police said. The boy, who suffered multiple fractures, was taken to a hospital, however, doctors declared him dead during the treatment.

50.title: Wife kills husband over her illicit affair with tenant in Delhi; held
50.article_body: A woman killed her husband over an alleged illicit affair she was having with their family's tenant in Delhi's Rithala. Police arrested the accused, identified as Seema, and six other people for plotting and killing the victim. One of the six people arrested included the tenant, Gaurav Teotia, who was found to have been involved with Seema for eight years.

51.title: BBMP imposes ₹6 lakh fine as 200kg single-use plastic seized in B'luru
51.article_body: The BBMP has carried out surprise inspections at plastic production units and shops selling single-use plastic in Bengaluru. During the inspection, BBMP seized 200 kg single-use plastic from a plastic-producing unit and imposed a fine of ₹6,00,000 on it. Notably, single-use plastic is completely banned in Bengaluru and therefore, penalties are being levied on shops that are violating this order.

52.title: US women’s football team reaches $24 million settlement over equal pay
52.article_body: Players from the US women's football team (USWNT) on Tuesday reached a $24 million settlement with the US Soccer Federation (USSF), plus bonuses that match the men's team, ending a six-year battle over equal pay. USSF agreed to provide equal pay rates to both men's and women's teams, including World Cup bonuses. The USWNT have won four FIFA World Cups.

53.title: Very tough to quickly replace Russian gas supplies to Europe: Qatar
53.article_body: Qatar's Energy Minister said that neither Qatar nor any other single country has the capacity to replace Russian gas supplies to Europe with LNG in the event of disruption due to Ukrainian conflict. "Russia (provides) I think 30-40% of the supply to Europe," he added. "So, to replace that sum of volume that quickly is almost impossible," he further said.

54.title: 3 police officers injured as COVID-19 protest turns violent in NZ
54.article_body: Police on Tuesday said a protester against COVID-19 mandates in New Zealand drove their car towards lines of police, with three officers taken to hospital after being sprayed with an unknown "stinging" substance. Protesters, inspired by Canada's 'Freedom Convoy', have camped near Wellington's Parliament for two weeks. "What's happening in Wellington is wrong," Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern said.

55.title: Omicron led to more COVID-19 deaths in US than Delta: Reports
55.article_body: The Seattle Times on Saturday reported that the Omicron variant of COVID-19 led to more deaths in the United States than those recorded during the Delta wave. The US has reported over 1,54,750 deaths since November 24, some 22,000 deaths more than the 1,32,616 reported during the worst of the Delta wave between August 1 and October 31, 2021.

56.title: 9 arrested by police after Leeds Utd's match with Man Utd in PL
56.article_body: Police on Monday said nine people were arrested following Leeds United's Premier League match with Manchester United on Sunday. Manchester United's Anthony Elanga appeared to be hit by an object thrown from the crowd. "Officers were deployed in sufficient numbers to rapidly intervene to identify and arrest the people responsible and prevent any escalation in disorder," West Yorkshire Police said.

57.title: Govt tracking crude prices to decide possible cut in fuel tax: FM
57.article_body: Government is keeping an eye on geopolitical developments affecting crude oil prices to take a call on a possible duty cut in fuel prices, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said. This comes after Brent crude touched its seven-year high of $99.50/barrel amid rising Russia-Ukraine tensions. Indian fuel prices have remained unchanged for over two months despite rise in global oil prices.

58.title: PMJJBY subscribers not eligible for shares at discounted rates: LIC
58.article_body: Subscribers of Pradhan Mantri Jeevan Jyoti Bima Yojana (PMJJBY) are ineligible for shares at a discounted price in the upcoming LIC IPO, the insurer clarified on Tuesday. "It is a group insurance product and [PMJJBY policyholders] aren't eligible," LIC said in a statement. This comes after LIC Chairman MR Kumar on Monday said PMJJBY subscribers are eligible for discounted shares.

59.title: 'America's Got Talent' contestant Jane Marczewski dies due to cancer aged 31
59.article_body: Singer Jane Marczewski, who gained widespread recognition after her audition last year on 'America's Got Talent', died on February 19 at the age of 31 after a prolonged battle with cancer. Known by her stage name 'Nightbirde', Marczewski battled cancer for four years. "We, her family, are devastated by her passing and unimaginable loss," her family stated.

60.title: Koladiya not even an employee, used 'foul language' on a call: BharatPe's Ashneer
60.article_body: BharatPe Co-founder Ashneer Grover in a letter to the board of Resilient Innovations, the parent of BharatPe, accused Bhavik Koladiya, one of BharatPe's original Co-founders, of using "foul language" on a call with him. In the letter seen by Moneycontrol, Ashneer said, "Koladiya is neither a Member of the Board nor an employee of the Company."

61.title: US spy planes seen circling over Ukraine amid tensions with Russia: Flight tracker
61.article_body: Two US spy planes have travelled on regular missions to Ukraine and navigated in repeated loops in the largely empty airspace over the past month, as per flight tracker Flightradar24. Their flights have coincided with a military build-up by Russia along the Ukrainian border. Aviation watchers speculated that the US is making its presence known in a show of force.

62.title: Want to do films that make my heart skip a beat: Alia Bhatt
62.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt has said she wants to be part of movies that "make her heart skip a beat". "I will do a film that gives me energy every time I wake [up], a film that makes me want to rush to sets," Alia said. She also said her next 10-year plan is to build her production house.

63.title: Men need to understand women are much stronger: Madhavan
63.article_body: R Madhavan, speaking about gender equality, said, "Men need to understand a simple rule...physically and mentally, women are much stronger as you grow older." To back his statement, Madhavan said in many households, grandmothers are the last ones standing compared to grandfathers. He added, "It'll work well for men if they...invest in their future by being understanding to...ladies in...house."

64.title: Assam govt employee arrested after being caught accepting bribe
64.article_body: A team from Assam Police's Vigilance and Anti-Corruption cell on Tuesday arrested a health department employee in Tezpur for allegedly accepting a bribe. The team had laid a trap on the basis of a complaint following which the accused Bhupen Borah was caught red-handed. Borah had demanded the bribe from the complainant for providing the Form-16 Certificate, police said.

65.title: Romania preparing to take in 5 lakh Ukrainian refugees: Defence Min
65.article_body: Romanian Defence Minister Vasile Dîncu on Tuesday said that Romania is preparing to receive up to 5 lakh potential refugees from Ukraine in case of a Russian invasion. "There is a plan prepared for all large cities, there are areas for this near the borders," he added. This comes after Russia recognised two breakaway Ukrainian regions as independent.

66.title: Shaheen Afridi, you beauty: Shahid Afridi after Shaheen slams 3 sixes in last over
66.article_body: After Lahore Qalandars captain Shaheen Afridi smashed three sixes and a four in last over of their PSL 2022 match against Peshawar Zalmi, Shahid Afridi tweeted, "Shaheen Afridiiii you beautyyy!!!" Shahid also shared a collage showing Shaheen's celebration from the match and a similar throwback picture of himself. Shaheen's effort helped his team take the match to the Super Over.

67.title: Excited to work with Akshay Kumar in 'Bade Miyan...': Tiger Shroff
67.article_body: Actor Tiger Shroff said that he is excited to work in his upcoming film 'Bade Miyan Chote Miyan' as it gives him a chance to work with actor Akshay Kumar. "My father always tells me to follow his example...I know I've been his fan for as long as I can remember." The film will be directed by Ali Abbas Zafar.

68.title: Usual nonsense: Deverakonda on marriage rumours with Rashmika
68.article_body: Telugu actor Vijay Deverakonda has denied rumours of marrying actress Rashmika Mandanna. "As usual nonsense," he wrote on Twitter. "Don't we just (heart emoji) da news!" he added. Some media reports had claimed the duo were tying the knot soon. "I presume this must be the end to the pseudo journalism," a fan wrote in response to the actor's tweet.

69.title: Opp'n looted country in name of 'garibi hatao', samajwad: PM Modi
69.article_body: PM Narendra Modi, while campaigning in Uttar Pradesh on Tuesday, attacked the opposition saying, they looted the country in the name of "garibi hatao (remove poverty) and samajwad (socialism)". Further hitting out at Samajwadi Party for terming COVID-19 vaccine as 'BJP's Vaccine,' he said, "Just like you didn't hear them for vaccines, do not hear them for votes as well."

70.title: He's world-class player: David on playing under Rohit-led MI in IPL 2022
70.article_body: Mumbai Indians' new signing Tim David said he's excited to bat alongside Kieron Pollard, adding it'll be a huge bonus for him to spend time with "world-class player" and captain Rohit Sharma in IPL 2022. "Rohit just looks so effortless when he bats...very admirable," he added. The Singapore all-rounder was bought for ₹8.25 crore in IPL mega auction 2022.

71.title: Ireland to drop most of its remaining COVID-19 curbs on February 28
71.article_body: Ireland has said it will drop most of its remaining COVID-19 restrictions from February 28 onwards. The relaxation of curbs will include an end to physical distancing measures in schools, scaling back of COVID-19 testing and lifting of legal mandate requiring people to wear masks. "Current epidemiological profile of COVID-19 in Ireland is broadly stable," the government said.

72.title: Important for India to be strong: PM amid Ukraine-Russia conflict
72.article_body: Amid the escalating Ukraine-Russia conflict, PM Narendra Modi said, "It is imperative for India to be strong for itself and for the entire human race." There is a lot of turmoil in the world right now, he added. "Today, your every vote will make India stronger and help further strengthen the country," he further said.

73.title: Bulk of medicines found discarded in Bihar hospital; probe on
73.article_body: A large number of assorted medicines were allegedly found discarded at an almost inaccessible corner of a Bihar hospital. The discovery, which also included several medicines discarded before its expiration date, was made during a sting operation conducted by Times Now at Sadar Hospital, Hajipur. An immediate enquiry was ordered by Vaishali Civil Surgeon Dr Akhilesh Mohan.

74.title: 6 EU nations send team to help Ukraine deal with cyber threats
74.article_body: Six European Union (EU) countries, including Lithuania, Netherlands, Poland, Estonia, Romania and Croatia, have sent a team of cybersecurity experts to Ukraine to help deal with cyber threats amid tensions with Russia. The US and the UK on Friday had said that Russian military hackers were behind recent cyberattacks on Ukraine. However, Russia has denied any role in the cyberattacks.

75.title: Sanjeev Sanyal joins PM's Economic Advisory Council as full-time member
75.article_body: Noted economist Sanjeev Sanyal has been inducted as a full-time member of the Economic Advisory Council to the Prime Minister (EAC-PM), the council's Chairman Bibek Debroy announced on Tuesday. Prior to this, Sanyal was serving as the Principal Economic Advisor in the Finance Ministry. The EAC-PM is an independent body that advises the Prime Minister on economic and related issues.

76.title: Australia announce 16-member white-ball squad for Pakistan tour
76.article_body: Australia have named a 16-player squad for the white-ball leg of their tour of Pakistan, with David Warner, Pat Cummins, Josh Hazlewood, Mitchell Starc and Glenn Maxwell to miss the leg. Aaron Finch will lead the side, which also includes Sean Abbott, Mitchell Marsh, Kane Richardson, Steve Smith, Marcus Stoinis and Adam Zampa.

77.title: Assumed my role was finished after 'Captain America...': Sebastian
77.article_body: Hollywood actor Sebastian Stan has said he had assumed that his role was finished after 'Captain America: The First Avenger'. "I certainly did not know that I would be playing the role for 10 years," he said in an interview. "I remember...being told about this role. But it didn't seem like there was any commitment, really," Sebastian added.

78.title: Rajnath Singh's speech in UP disrupted by youths, 1 man detained
78.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh's election speech was disrupted by some youths in UP's Ballia on Tuesday who claimed that Army recruitment is on hold for three years. Singh responded saying the process was underway, adding that things take wrong turn when politics is brought in. Meanwhile, a man was detained during the rally for raising 'Akhilesh Yadav zindabad' slogan.

79.title: Only PM Modi had the will to revoke it: JP Nadda on triple talaq
79.article_body: While addressing a rally in Uttar Pradesh's Deoria, BJP president Jagat Prakash Nadda said that only "PM Narendra Modi Ji had the will to revoke the 13th-century practice" of triple talaq. "Supreme Court had ordered abolishing the triple talaq practice but nobody acted on it because of the politics of appeasement," he further said.

80.title: Dombivli ward boy molests 75-yr-old woman while taking X-ray, held
80.article_body: A 22-year-old private hospital's ward boy has been arrested for allegedly molesting a 75-year-old woman twice while she was being taken for a chest X-ray. Dombivli Ramnagar police officials said the accused was identified as Kanadas Vaishnav. The victim was allegedly touched inappropriately while being given instructions for standing for the X-ray by Vaishnav in Dombivli, Maharashtra, on Monday.

81.title: DMK gets majority in Chennai by winning 153 wards in TN urban local polls
81.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin-led DMK on Tuesday won 153 wards out of 200 in Chennai in urban local body polls. Congress won 13 wards and AIADMK won 15 wards. BJP settled for one ward and CPI(M) won four wards. "I will work to maintain the trust that people have placed in me," tweeted Stalin after the results.

82.title: Dubsmash shuts down seven years after its launch
82.article_body: American short-form video social platform Dubsmash officially shuts down on February 22, 2022, a little more than seven years after its launch. Reddit, which acquired Dubsmash in December 2020, is shutting the platform after absorbing much of its functionality. Dubsmash will no longer be available for download in the Apple App Store or Google Play Store.

83.title: Man who pushed wife to death after taking selfie in Turkey suing people for insulting him
83.article_body: A 41-year-old man who pushed his pregnant wife off a cliff in Turkey to claim their accident insurance is suing hundreds of people for damages for allegedly insulting him on social media. He's reportedly seeking around ₹27,000 from each person who insulted him. The man, who is serving life imprisonment, had clicked a selfie with his wife before killing her.

84.title: Perry put lot of pressure on himself during 'Friends': Co-star Cox
84.article_body: Actress Courteney Cox has said his 'Friends' co-star Matthew Perry had put a lot of pressure on himself while playing Chandler Bing in the sitcom. "That's a lot to think how much he relied on that for his own self-worth," Cox said. Last year, Perry had admitted that the audience's reaction to his performance greatly affected his mental health.

85.title: Mumbai logs 135 COVID-19 cases, 2 deaths in the last 24 hrs
85.article_body: Mumbai reported 135 new COVID-19 cases and two related deaths in the last 24 hours. Moreover, 233 COVID-19 recoveries were reported in Mumbai, with the city currently having 1,315 active cases. Maharashtra reported 1,080 fresh COVID-19 cases on Tuesday, taking the overall infection tally in the state to 78,60,317. Active cases in the state stand at 13,070.

86.title: Delhi reports 498 COVID-19 cases & 1 death in the last 24 hrs
86.article_body: Delhi reported 498 new COVID-19 cases and one related death in the last 24 hours, taking the overall infection tally in the city to 18,57,015. Moreover, 411 recoveries were reported in the national capital, with the city currently having 2,367 active cases. With one more death, the fatality count in Delhi has reached 26,106.

87.title: I'll be with Argentina squad at 2022 World Cup in Qatar: Aguero
87.article_body: Sergio Aguero, who retired from professional football in December 2021, has revealed that he will be part of Argentina's backroom staff at the 2022 World Cup in Qatar. The 33-year-old former striker  made this announcement after a meeting with Argentine Football Association (AFA) President Claudio Tapia on Monday. Aguero was forced to quit the sport due to a heart condition.

88.title: Air India flight from Ukraine with 240 on board to land in Delhi tonight
88.article_body: An Air India plane carrying over 240 passengers from Ukraine is expected to land in Delhi on Tuesday night, officials said. The flight took off from Boryspil International Airport in Kyiv at around 6 pm, the officials said. The Indian embassy in Kyiv on Tuesday again asked Indian students to temporarily leave Ukraine amid the rising tensions.

89.title: Gives huge confidence: Praggnanandhaa on beating world champion Carlsen
89.article_body: Grandmaster R Praggnanandhaa, who became third Indian to beat Magnus Carlsen, said the win against world number one gives him "huge confidence". The 16-year-old defeated world champion in eighth round of ongoing Airthings Masters. "It was very hard because...game starts early morning at 3 am. I prepared for it everyday by changing my routine to the tournament's schedule," he added.

90.title: Saudi Arabia marks nearly 300-yr-old 'Founding Day' for first time
90.article_body: Saudi Arabia held celebrations on Tuesday to commemorate its foundation nearly 300 years ago for the first time. The celebratory events included musical performances on Saudi modern history and fireworks, local media has reported. February 22 marks the anniversary of the day in 1727 when Mohammed bin Saud, who was founder of first Saudi state, took over emirate of Diriyah.

91.title: Hungary to deploy troops near Ukrainian border amid crisis: Govt
91.article_body: Hungarian Defence Ministry on Tuesday announced deployment of an unspecified number of troops near Ukrainian border for security and humanitarian tasks. Hungary's security is most important, we are reinforcing the border, ministry said. This comes after Russian President Vladimir Putin ordered "peacekeeping operation" in Ukraine's breakaway regions after recognising their independence on Monday.

92.title: Woman cleans window standing on railing of building in Ghaziabad, video viral
92.article_body: A video of a woman cleaning a windowpane while standing on a railing of a highrise building in Ghaziabad has surfaced online. As per reports, the woman is a resident of the Shipra Riviera Society and the woman who filmed the incident tried to call her several times but the woman was busy cleaning the windowpane.

93.title: Sharad Pawar seeks time to appear before Koregaon-Bhima panel
93.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar, who was to appear before the Koregaon-Bhima Inquiry Commission on February 23 and 24, has submitted an application before it seeking more time. He'll definitely appear in the future to record his version of events, NCP spokesperson Nawab Malik said. The panel, which is probing the 2018 violence, had summoned Pawar to depose as a witness.

94.title: Drugs worth ₹51.83 crore seized in Mizoram in 2021-22: Governor
94.article_body: Mizoram Governor Hari Babu Kambhampati on Tuesday said that the police seized narcotic substances valued at ₹51.83 crore in 2021-22. Altogether 2,112 people were arrested in narcotic drugs and prohibition related cases during the financial year, he added. The government is making all-out efforts to curb drug trafficking, Kambhampati further said.

95.title: This is an election to save democracy, change fate of UP: Akhilesh
95.article_body: While addressing a rally at Bhirpur in Yamunapar's Karchana assembly constituency in Uttar Pradesh, Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav said this election is to save the democracy and change the fate of Uttar Pradesh. "We will work to implement the SP manifesto. Ever since the BJP government came, inflation and unemployment have increased," he further added.
